tool_args.notes: CRITICAL BLOCKER: This is the foundational automation issue. Without semantic triggers, automations only work when changes go through API routes — not when data is edited externally (Cursor, manual JSON, other AI). The file watcher exists but only fires generic file_changed. Need: diff entity state before/after, fire typed triggers (session_ended, issue_created, item_completed). This makes triggers code-path-independent. Blocks reliable automation system.

This is the single biggest cost optimization available.

tool_args.content:
SESSION-END AUDIT COMPLETE (Feb 9, 2026)

HEALTH: 84% (↑2 from 82%). 11 systems assessed. 2 degraded: CLI (48%), Integrations (42%). 9 systems healthy at 70%+.

KEY FINDINGS:
1. **epic-hierarchy-ui marked completed** — session 9 fully delivered the user need (epic grouping visible in UI). Remaining work (parent_idea field, deeper nesting) was out of original scope.
2. **ui-design-overhaul corrected to pending** — phase 2 never started, was incorrectly marked in_progress for 10+ days.
3. **session-self-audit validated** — automation ran successfully after session 8 (164s, 25 tool calls). Automation engine + headless runner proven working.
4. **Docs generation system production-ready** — discovery agent, per-doc writers, 4-layer framework, parallel execution, verification + retry, recovery pass, three-column UI, Mermaid rendering, sub-pages, provenance tracking. Total cost: ~$50 (Opus 4.6 + Opus 4.5 + Sonnet). 14 docs generated.
5. **Chat agent validated** — session 9 proved investigation + handoff pattern. ISS-035 found and documented by chat agent, fixed by Cursor.
6. **ISS-034 (semantic watcher) is CRITICAL BLOCKER** — automations only work via API routes, not external edits. Blocks full self-healing system.
7. **ISS-043 (prompt caching) is biggest cost optimization** — 0 cache reads despite 130K token prompts. If working: $8 instead of $36 (90% savings).
8. **Git clean** — 14 uncommitted data files are normal session state (config, velocity, session log, etc.). All code committed.

CONTRADICTIONS FOUND: None. All data consistent.

STALE DATA FIXED:
- epic-hierarchy-ui: pending → completed
- ui-design-overhaul: in_progress → pending
- System health scores updated: web-ui (70→85), ai-intelligence (65→80), server (87→90), cursor-rule (62→75), session-tracking (80→88), brain (78→70)
- Issue notes enhanced with current context (ISS-034, ISS-043, ISS-006, ISS-012, ISS-003)
- Epic summaries updated with validation status
- Context recovery refreshed with session 10 outcomes

NEXT SESSION PRIORITIES:
1. Browser test Docs tab end-to-end (three-column layout, Mermaid, cost modal, progress bar, sub-pages)
2. Audit prompts for DevTrack-specific references — must be fully project-agnostic before Landmark
3. Test multi-project: init DevTrack on Landmark, test project switching
4. Run end-to-end initialization on Landmark — the real validation
5. Investigate ISS-043 (prompt caching) — 90% cost savings available
6. Resolve ISS-034 (semantic watcher) — critical for automation reliability

steps.content:
## Session-End Audit Complete ✅

I've performed a comprehensive audit of all DevTrack data with depth and precision. Here's the summary:

### 🎯 Overall Health: 84% (↑2 from 82%)

**What I Audited:**
- ✅ **46 Roadmap items** across all horizons
- ✅ **6 Open issues** (1 critical, 2 high, 2 medium, 1 low)
- ✅ **8 Epics** with progress tracking
- ✅ **1 Milestone** (v0.2 completed)
- ✅ **73 Ideas** across all statuses
- ✅ **11 Systems** with health scores
- ✅ **16 Docs** (all auto-generated)
- ✅ **10 Sessions** with velocity data
- ✅ **87 Changelog entries**
- ✅ **27 Brain notes**
- ✅ **Git status** (14 uncommitted data files - normal)

---

### 🔧 **Stale Data Corrected:**

1. **epic-hierarchy-ui** → Marked **completed** (session 9 fully delivered epic visibility in UI)
2. **ui-design-overhaul** → Corrected to **pending** (phase 2 never started, was incorrectly in_progress for 10+ days)
3. **session-self-audit** → Enhanced notes (automation validated — ran successfully after session 8)
4. **System health scores updated:**
   - web-ui: 70% → **85%** (ISS-039 fixed, Docs UI shipped, stable)
   - ai-intelligence: 65% → **80%** (chat agent validated in session 9)
   - server: 87% → **90%** (automation engine proven working)
   - cursor-rule: 62% → **75%** (automation provides structural enforcement)
   - session-tracking: 80% → **88%** (velocity data complete)
   - brain: 78% → **70%** (note bloat concern from large reports)

5. **Issue notes enhanced** with current context:
   - **ISS-034** (critical): Semantic watcher is foundational blocker for automation reliability
   - **ISS-043** (high): Prompt caching = 90% cost savings ($8 vs $36)
   - **ISS-006** (high): Partially resolved — automation engine provides structural enforcement, blocked by ISS-034
   - **ISS-012** (high): Conversation bridge proven in session 9 (investigation + handoff pattern)
   - **ISS-003** (medium): 13+ days old, Helicone still failing

6. **Epic summaries refreshed:**
   - automation-audits: Complete and validated
   - codebase-intelligence: 2/3 shipped, docs system production-ready
   - ai-intelligence-engine: Chat-first architecture validated
   - automation-self-healing: Blocked by ISS-034 semantic watcher

7. **Context recovery updated** with session 10 outcomes and session 11 objectives

---

### ⚠️ **Critical Findings:**

**ISS-034 (Semantic File Watcher) is the CRITICAL BLOCKER:**
- Automations only work when changes go through API routes
- External edits (Cursor, manual JSON) don't fire typed triggers
- Blocks reliable automation system
- **Must be resolved for full self-healing**

**ISS-043 (Prompt Caching) is biggest cost optimization:**
- 0 cache reads despite 130K token system prompts
- If working: **90% cost savings** ($8 instead of $36 per docs run)
- Single biggest optimization available

---

### 🚀 **Validation Status:**

✅ **Chat agent** — Validated in session 9 with real browser conversations  
✅ **Automation engine** — Proven working (session-end-audit, change-tracker, weekly-report all executed)  
✅ **Docs generation** — Production-ready system with discovery agent + per-doc writers  
✅ **Epic hierarchy** — Fully delivered in session 9  
⏳ **Docs prompts** — Need audit for project-agnosticism before Landmark  
⏳ **Multi-project** — Infrastructure ready, needs Landmark dogfood test  
❌ **Semantic watcher** — Critical blocker, not started  

---

### 📊 **Data Integrity:**

- **0 contradictions found** — all data consistent
- **Git clean** — 14 uncommitted data files are normal session state (config, velocity, session log)
- **Velocity accurate** — 128 items, 421 points across 10 sessions
- **All systems assessed** — 9/11 healthy (70%+), 2 degraded (CLI 48%, Integrations 42%)

---

### 🎯 **Next Session Priorities:**

1. **Browser test Docs tab** end-to-end (three-column layout, Mermaid, cost modal, progress bar, sub-pages)
2. **Audit prompts** for DevTrack-specific references — must be project-agnostic before Landmark
3. **Test multi-project** — init DevTrack on Landmark, test project switching
4. **Run end-to-end initialization on Landmark** — the real validation
5. **Investigate ISS-043** (prompt caching) — 90% cost savings available
6. **Resolve ISS-034** (semantic watcher) — critical for automation reliability

---

**Audit complete.** All stale data corrected, all contradictions resolved, context recovery refreshed. The system is ready for Landmark dogfooding pending Docs tab browser validation and prompt agnosticism audit.
